_**Dora the Explorer**_ is an American [educational](/wiki/Education
"Education") [animated TV series](/wiki/Animated_TV_series "Animated TV
series") created by Chris Gifford, Valerie Walsh, and Eric Weiner. _Dora the
Explorer_ became a regular series in 2000. The show is carried on the
[Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon") [cable
television](/wiki/Cable_television "Cable television") network, including the
associated [Nick Jr.](/wiki/Nick_Jr. "Nick Jr.") channel. It aired on
[CBS](/wiki/CBS "CBS") until September 2006. A Spanish-dubbed version first
aired as part of a _Nick en español_ block on [NBC
Universal](/wiki/NBC_Universal "NBC Universal")-owned
[Telemundo](/wiki/Telemundo "Telemundo") through September 2006; since April
2008, this version of the program has been carried on
[Univision](/wiki/Univision "Univision") as part of the _[Planeta
U](/wiki/Planeta_U "Planeta U")_ block. The series is co-produced by
[Nickelodeon Productions](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon") and [Nickelodeon
Animation Studio](/wiki/Nickelodeon_Animation_Studio "Nickelodeon Animation
Studio"). _Dora the Explorer_ is one of the longest-running shows of Nick Jr.
During the [sixth
season](/wiki/List_of_Dora_the_Explorer_episodes#Season_6_.282010.E2.80.932012.29
"List of Dora the Explorer episodes"), the show became the Nick Jr. series
with the most episodes, surpassing _[Blue's Clues](/wiki/Blue%27s_Clues
"Blue's Clues")_ with 143 episodes, having 144 after it had completed
broadcasting on television. It won a [Peabody Award](/wiki/Peabody_Award
"Peabody Award") in 2003 "for outstanding efforts in making learning a
pleasurable experience for pre-schoolers." It ended on June 5, 2014 after 8
seasons and 172 episodes.[1]

## Plot

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/6/64/Dora_and_Boots.jpg/200px-
Dora_and_Boots.jpg)](/wiki/File:Dora_and_Boots.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Dora_and_Boots.jpg "Enlarge")

From left to right: Swiper (in background), Dora, and Boots

The series centers around Dora, a 7 (Later 8) year old American girl of
[Indigenous Mexican](/wiki/Indigenous_Mexican "Indigenous Mexican") heritage,
with a love of embarking on quests related to an activity that she wants to
partake of or a place that she wants to go to, accompanied by her talking
[purple](/wiki/Purple "Purple") [backpack](/wiki/Backpack "Backpack") and
anthropomorphic monkey companion named Boots (named for his beloved pair of
red [boots](/wiki/Boots "Boots")). Each episode is based around a series of
cyclical events that occur along the way during Dora's travels, along with
obstacles that she and Boots are forced to overcome or puzzles that they have
to solve (with "assistance" from the viewing audience) relating to
[riddles](/wiki/Riddles "Riddles"), the Spanish language, or counting. Common
rituals may involve Dora's encounters with Swiper, a [bipedal](/wiki/Bipedal
"Bipedal"), [anthropomorphic](/wiki/Anthropomorphic "Anthropomorphic") masked
thieving [fox](/wiki/Fox "Fox") whose theft of the possessions of others must
be prevented through [fourth wall](/wiki/Fourth_wall "Fourth wall")-breaking
interaction with the viewer. To stop Swiper, Dora must say "Swiper no swiping"
three times. However, on occasions where Swiper steals the belongings of other
people, the viewer is presented with the challenge of helping Boots and Dora
locate the stolen items. Another obstacle involves encounters with another one
of the program's antagonists; the "Grumpy Old Troll" dwelling beneath a
[bridge](/wiki/Bridge "Bridge") that Dora and Boots must cross, who challenges
them with a riddle before permitting them the past that needs to be solved
with the viewer's help. Known for the constant breaking of the fourth-wall
depicted in every episode, the audience is usually presented to two primary
landmarks that must be passed before Dora can reach her destination, normally
being challenged with games or puzzles along the way. The episode always ends
with Dora successfully reaching the locale, singing the "We Did It!" song with
Boots in triumph.

On numerous occasions, television specials have been aired for the series in
which the usual events of regular episodes are altered, threatened, or
replaced. Usually said specials will present Dora with a bigger, more
whimsical adventure than usual or with a magical task that must be fulfilled,
or perhaps even offer a series of different adventures for Boots and Dora to
travel through. They might be presented with an unusual, difficult task (such
as assisting Swiper in his attempts to be erased from Santa Claus's Naughty
List) that normally is not featured in average episodes, or challenge Dora
with a goal that must be achieved (such as the emancipation of a trapped
[mermaid](/wiki/Mermaid "Mermaid")). Sometimes, the specials have involved the
debut of new characters, such as the birth of Dora's superpowered twin baby
siblings and the introduction of the enchanted anthropomorphic
[stars](/wiki/Stars "Stars") that accompany Dora on many of her quests.

## Development

Dora is a [Latina](/wiki/Latino "Latino"). According to a Nickelodeon
spokesman, "She was developed to be pan-Latina to represent the diversity of
Latino cultures."[5]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/2/20/Dora_grows_up.jpg/120px-
Dora_grows_up.jpg)](/wiki/File:Dora_grows_up.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Dora_grows_up.jpg "Enlarge")

Dora the Explorer as a [tween](/wiki/Preadolescence "Preadolescence"), as seen
after being revealed in 2009.

On March 8, 2009, [Mattel](/wiki/Mattel "Mattel") and
[Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon") announced that Dora will
receive a [tweenage](/wiki/Tween_\(demographic\) "Tween \(demographic\)")
makeover, switching from a young age to a teenage attending [middle
school](/wiki/Middle_school "Middle school"). Initially, it was announced that
the new look would not be revealed until late 2009,[6] but after a short
controversy, the tween Dora was unveiled on March 16, 2009.[7][8][9] The
change was criticized by one writer that did not support the feminization of
Dora's image.[10]

In 2012, a CGI opening was created for new episodes of the series.[11]

### Dora's Explorer Girls

In 2009, Mattel and Nickelodeon introduced a preteen version of Dora, with
four friends named Naiya, Kate, Emma, and Alana, who call themselves the
Explorer Girls.[12] The Explorer Girls were included in the _[Dora and
Friends](/wiki/Dora_and_Friends "Dora and Friends")_ spin-off in 2014.

## Foreign adaptations

_Dora the Explorer_ has been produced in various other languages worldwide. It
facilitates the learning of important foreign language words or phrases
(mostly English, interspersed with a local language (e.g. Norwegian, Russian,
Hindi, or German), with occasional use of Spanish (used in the Gaelic,
Serbian, and Turkish versions)) through its simplicity and use of repetition.

  * **Arabic** – The [Arabic language](/wiki/Arabic_language "Arabic language") version is broadcast on the "Nickelodeon on MBC3" block of MBC3, and is presented in Arabic-English.
  * **Cantonese** – The [Cantonese language](/wiki/Cantonese_language "Cantonese language") version ([Chinese](/wiki/Chinese_language "Chinese language"): 愛探險的朵拉; literally: "Explore-loving Dora") is sold in Hong Kong. It is presented in Cantonese-English.
  * **Danish** – The [Danish language](/wiki/Danish_language "Danish language") version is called "Dora – udforskeren" and there are commands and expressions in English. It is broadcast on the national public children's channel, [DR Ramasjang](/wiki/DR_Ramasjang "DR Ramasjang"), and also on [Nick Jr.](/wiki/Nick_Jr. "Nick Jr.") through various [pay TV](/wiki/Pay_TV "Pay TV") providers.
  * **Dutch** – The [Dutch language](/wiki/Dutch_language "Dutch language") version broadcasts on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon_\(Netherlands\) "Nickelodeon \(Netherlands\)") and [Nick. Jr](/wiki/Nick_Jr._\(Netherlands_%26_Flanders\) "Nick Jr. \(Netherlands & Flanders\)"), It is presented in Dutch-English. The voice actors are Lottie Hellingman as Dora and Dieter Jansen as Boots.
  * **French** – The [French language](/wiki/French_language "French language") version, _Dora l 'exploratrice_, broadcasts on [TF1](/wiki/TF1 "TF1") in France and [Télé-Québec](/wiki/T%C3%A9l%C3%A9-Qu%C3%A9bec "Télé-Québec") in Canada. It is presented in French-English, with Dora and Boots (called Babouche) speaking French and other protagonists speaking and answering in English.
  * **Filipino** – The [Filipino language](/wiki/Filipino_language "Filipino language") version broadcasts on [ABS-CBN](/wiki/ABS-CBN "ABS-CBN") and has the same English title "Dora, the Explorer". The characters speak Filipino and some English, Dora teaches English in this version.
  * **German** – The [German language](/wiki/German_language "German language") version broadcasts on the German branch of [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nick_Germany "Nick Germany"). The bilingualism is German-English.
  * **Greek** – The [Greek language](/wiki/Greek_language "Greek language") version is called _" Ντόρα η μικρή εξερευνήτρια"_ (or _Dora the Little Explorer_). It broadcasts on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon_\(Greece\) "Nickelodeon \(Greece\)") and [Star Channel](/wiki/Star_Channel_\(Greece\) "Star Channel \(Greece\)"). The bilingualism is Greek-English. Dora and Boots (called _Botas_) speak Greek and other protagonists speak and answer in English.
  * **Hebrew** – The [Hebrew language](/wiki/Hebrew_language "Hebrew language") version broadcasts on HOP channel. The bilingualism is Hebrew-English. The series is called _מגלים עם דורה_ (or _Megalim Im Dora_ \--**English:** _Discovering with Dora_).
  * **Hindi** – In the [Hindi language](/wiki/Hindi_language "Hindi language") version, Dora and the other characters speak Hindi. It broadcasts on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nick_India "Nick India") and [Nick Jr](/wiki/Nick_Jr_India "Nick Jr India"). Dora teaches the viewers English words and numbers.
  * **Hungarian** – In the [Hungarian language](/wiki/Hungarian_language "Hungarian language") version, Dora and the other characters speak Hungarian with some English words or phrases. It broadcasts on [Nickelodeon (Hungary)](/wiki/Nickelodeon_\(Hungary\) "Nickelodeon \(Hungary\)"). The series is called Dóra a felfedező.
  * **Indonesian** – The [Indonesian language](/wiki/Indonesian_language "Indonesian language") version broadcasts on [Global TV](/wiki/Global_TV "Global TV"). The bilingualism is Indonesian-English.
  * **Irish** – The [Irish language](/wiki/Irish_language "Irish language") version broadcasts on the Irish station [TG4](/wiki/TG4 "TG4"). The bilingualism is Irish-Spanish with Dora and Boots speaking in Irish and some other characters speaking Spanish as in the original American version.
  * **Italian** – The [Italian language](/wiki/Italian_language "Italian language") version broadcasts on [Cartoonito](/wiki/Cartoonito "Cartoonito") and on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon"). The bilingualism is Italian-English. The series is called _Dora l 'esploratrice_ ("Dora the Explorer"). Most characters speak Italian, but some characters and especially Dora's parents and backpack speak English along with Italian.
  * **Japanese** – The [Japanese language](/wiki/Japanese_language "Japanese language") version broadcasts on [Nick Japan](/wiki/Nickelodeon_\(Japan\) "Nickelodeon \(Japan\)"). The bilingualism is Japanese-English, with Dora and Boots speaking Japanese and other protagonists speaking and answering in English. The version is called _ドーラといっしょに大冒険_ (_Dōra to issho ni dai bōken_ /_Adventures with Dora_).
  * **Kannada** – The [Kannada language](/wiki/Kannada_language "Kannada language") version broadcasts on Chintu TV and is a very popular program on that network. [Hindi](/wiki/Hindi "Hindi") is the second language in this version.
  * **Korean** – The [Korean language](/wiki/Korean_language "Korean language") version broadcasts on Nick Jr in Korea. The title is "Hi Dora" and is introduced by a real person whose name is Dami – she introduces key English vocabulary for each episode. The episode is primarily in Korean with some English.
  * **Macedonian** – The [Macedonian language](/wiki/Macedonian_language "Macedonian language") version broadcasts on [MRT 1](/wiki/MRT_1 "MRT 1") in Macedonia. The title is _" Дора истражува"_ (or _Dora the Explorer_). The bilingualism is Macedonian-English.
  * **Malay** – The [Malay language](/wiki/Malay_language "Malay language") version broadcasts on [TV9](/wiki/TV9_\(Malaysia\) "TV9 \(Malaysia\)"). The bilingualism is Malay-English. Dora speaks primarily in Malay, and the secondary language is English. The original English-Spanish version, however, is also available on [Nickelodeon South East Asia](/wiki/Nickelodeon_South_East_Asia "Nickelodeon South East Asia") via the [Nick Jr.](/wiki/Nick_Jr._\(block\) "Nick Jr. \(block\)") programming slot to subscribers of the [ASTRO](/wiki/Astro_\(satellite_TV\) "Astro \(satellite TV\)") satellite TV service.
  * **Malayalam** – The [Malayalam language](/wiki/Malayalam_language "Malayalam language") version is called _Dorayude Prayanam_ (ഡോറയുടെ പ്രയാണം) and broadcasts on a local kids programming channel [Kochu TV](/wiki/Kochu_TV "Kochu TV"), which is the Malayalam dubbed version of [Chutti TV](/wiki/Chutti_TV "Chutti TV").
  * **Mandarin** – In the [Mandarin Chinese language](/wiki/Standard_Chinese "Standard Chinese") version _Dora_ the characters speak mainly Mandarin with limited English. It broadcasts on Yo-yo TV in Taiwan (Channel 25).
  * **Maori** – The [Māori language](/wiki/M%C4%81ori_language "Māori language") version is called "_Dora Mātātoa_ ".
  * **Norwegian** – In the [Norwegian language](/wiki/Norwegian_language "Norwegian language") version, the bilingualism is Norwegian-English.
  * **Polish** – The [Polish language](/wiki/Polish_language "Polish language") version broadcasts on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon") in Poland. The bilingualism is Polish-English. The series is called _Dora poznaje świat_ ("Dora explores the world").
  * **Portuguese** – In the [Portuguese language](/wiki/Portuguese_language "Portuguese language") versions, _Dora a Exploradora_ broadcasts on [RTP2](/wiki/RTP2 "RTP2") and Nickelodeon Portugal. On [Nickelodeon Brazil](/wiki/Nickelodeon_Brazil "Nickelodeon Brazil"), the show is called _Dora a Aventureira_ , and Dora and Boots (called _Boots_ in the Portuguese version and Botas in the Brazilian version) speak Portuguese, while the other protagonists speak and answer in English. Some Portuguese episodes are available on DVD.
  * **Persian** – The [Persian language](/wiki/Persian_language "Persian language") version broadcasts on [Persian Toon](/wiki/Persian_Toon "Persian Toon"). The bilingualism is Persian-English.
  * **Russian** – The [Russian language](/wiki/Russian_language "Russian language") version broadcasts on TNT and [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon_\(CIS\) "Nickelodeon \(CIS\)"). The bilingualism is Russian-English. The series is called _Dasha-sledopyt_ ("Dasha the Pathfinder"). Dasha is the children's name of Daria (Darya).
  * **Serbian** – The [Serbian language](/wiki/Serbian_language "Serbian language") version broadcasts on [B92](/wiki/B92 "B92"). The bilingualism is Serbian-Spanish. The series is called _Dora istražuje_ (Dora is exploring).
  * **Spanish** – There are different [Spanish language](/wiki/Spanish_language "Spanish language") versions for Mexico, Latin America, and Spain. _Dora la Exploradora_ broadcasts on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon") in Latin America (and up to September 2006 on [Telemundo](/wiki/Telemundo "Telemundo") in the USA; from April 2008 on [Univisión](/wiki/Univisi%C3%B3n "Univisión")). Dora and Boots (called _Botas_) speak Spanish and the other protagonists speak and answer in English. Some Spanish episodes are available to US viewers on VHS, and some DVDs have a Spanish track (including Dora's Egg Hunt). This version is entirely the reverse of the original English version; Tico and Señor Tucan (called Mr. Toucan) only speak English. Additionally, Univision has added on-screen captions of the Spanish words spoken in English. In Spain, _Dora la exploradora_ is aired on [TVE 1](/wiki/TVE_1 "TVE 1"), [Clan TVE](/wiki/Clan_TVE "Clan TVE") and [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon_\(Spain\) "Nickelodeon \(Spain\)"). It is another reverse of the original English version (the characters speak mainly Spanish but there are commands and expressions in English).
  * **Swedish** – In the [Swedish language](/wiki/Swedish_language "Swedish language") version _Dora- utforskaren_ the characters speak mainly Swedish but there are commands and expressions in English. It broadcasts on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon_Sweden "Nickelodeon Sweden") and [TV4](/wiki/TV4_\(Sweden\) "TV4 \(Sweden\)").
  * **Tamil** – In the [Tamil language](/wiki/Tamil_language "Tamil language") version _Doravin Payanangal_ (டோராவின் பயணங்கள்), the characters all speak Tamil, with some English interspersed. It broadcasts on a local kids programming channel [Chutti TV](/wiki/Chutti_TV "Chutti TV").
  * **Thai** – In the [Thai language](/wiki/Thai_language "Thai language") version _ดอร่าดิเอกซ์พลอเรอร์_ or _ดอร่าสาวน้อยนักผจญภัย_ , the characters speak Thai; however, Tico speaks English. It broadcasts on Gang Cartoon Channel, [Nick Jr.](/wiki/Nick_Jr. "Nick Jr."), [Thai PBS](/wiki/Thai_PBS "Thai PBS").
  * **Turkish** – In the [Turkish language](/wiki/Turkish_language "Turkish language") version _Dora_ the characters speak mainly Turkish, Spanish, and English but there are commands and expressions in Turkish. It broadcasts on [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon") and [CNBC-e](/wiki/CNBC-e "CNBC-e").

As shown by the list above, the usual second language is English, but Spanish
is used in the original American version in English (broadcast also for Malay
speakers), in the Gaelic (Irish), Serbian, and the trilingual Turkish
versions.

## Stage adaptations

Two stage versions of Dora the Explorer toured North America, the first being
"City of Lost Toys", and the second being "Dora's Pirate Adventure". Produced
by Nickelodeon and [LiveNation](/wiki/LiveNation "LiveNation"), these
productions featured live actors portraying the roles of Dora and her friends,
including Boots, Diego, Isa, and the Fiesta Trio. Many of the characters wore
elaborate foam costumes designed to resemble the Dora characters. Each
production featured a structure similar to an episode of the television
series. City of Lost Toys featured [Christina Bianco](/wiki/Christina_Bianco
"Christina Bianco") as Dora while Dora's Pirate Adventure featured Danay
Ferrer of the band [Innosense](/wiki/Innosense "Innosense") in the role of
Dora and [Frankie Grande](/wiki/Frankie_Grande "Frankie Grande") as Boots.
Both productions featured a version of the popular [Gloria
Estefan](/wiki/Gloria_Estefan "Gloria Estefan") song "Get On Your Feet" as the
final number of the show. Both productions were conceived by Chris Gifford,
creator of the television show, and directed by Gip Hoppe.

There have been three Dora touring companies. The "City of Lost Toys" company
and the "Pirate Adventure" company featured actors and crew that were members
of [Actor's Equity](/wiki/Actor%27s_Equity "Actor's Equity") and
[IATSE](/wiki/IATSE "IATSE"), respectively, the unions for professional actors
and stagehands in the United States. The third company performs a reduced
version of "Pirate Adventure" and does not employ union personnel. This
production is currently touring North America, and scheduled to travel to the
United Kingdom and France.

## _Dora the Explorer_ merchandise

There are many action figures and playsets available in many markets, along
with DVDs, cosmetics, hygiene products, ride-ons, books, board games, plush
dolls, apparel, handbags, play tents, play kitchens, and more. Licensees
include [Fisher-Price](/wiki/Fisher-Price "Fisher-Price") in the United States
and [Holland Publishing](/wiki/Holland_Publishing "Holland Publishing") in the
United Kingdom.

### Toys

In 2004 [Lego](/wiki/Lego "Lego") released four sets based on the TV series'
characters. These include _7330 Dora 's Treasure Island_, _7331 Diego 's
Rescue Truck_, _7332 Dora and Boots at Play Park_ , and _7333 Dora and Diego
's Animal Adventure_.

In 2007, lead paint used by a contract toy manufacturer in China prompted
Mattel to issue recalls for nearly a million toys, many of which featured
_[Sesame Street](/wiki/Sesame_Street "Sesame Street")_ and Nickelodeon
characters, including Dora the Explorer. Nickelodeon responded that they would
introduce "third-party monitoring" of all manufacturers of products under its
brands.[13][14][15]

### Video games

Main article: [Dora the Explorer (video game
series)](/wiki/Dora_the_Explorer_\(video_game_series\) "Dora the Explorer
\(video game series\)")

[Video games](/wiki/Video_game "Video game") based on the 2000 television show
_Dora the Explorer_ were released. In Canada, [Cheerios](/wiki/Cheerios
"Cheerios") offered a free _Dora the Explorer the Game_ [CD-ROMs](/wiki/CD-ROM
"CD-ROM") in specially marked packages. However, packages sold in
[Quebec](/wiki/Quebec "Quebec") would only have the French version. _Dora the
Explorer: Barnyard Buddies_ is a video game released for the
[PlayStation](/wiki/PlayStation "PlayStation") in 2003 in the US. It was not
released in Europe until 2005 being one of the very last games released on
that platform in that territory. _[Dora the Explorer: Super Star
Adventures](/wiki/Dora_the_Explorer:_Super_Star_Adventures "Dora the Explorer:
Super Star Adventures")_ is an [adventure video
game](/wiki/Adventure_video_game "Adventure video game") for the [Game Boy
Advance](/wiki/Game_Boy_Advance "Game Boy Advance") released in 2004. It was
developed by Imaginengine and published by [Global
Star](/wiki/Global_Star_Software "Global Star Software").[16]

_Dora the Explorer: Journey to the Purple Planet_ is an [action-adventure
video game](/wiki/Action-adventure_game "Action-adventure game"), developed by
[Monkey Bar Games](/wiki/Monkey_Bar_Games "Monkey Bar Games"), published by
[Global Star Software](/wiki/Global_Star_Software "Global Star Software") and
powered by [Vicious Engine](/wiki/Vicious_Engine "Vicious Engine"). The game
was released for [GameCube](/wiki/GameCube "GameCube") in [North
America](/wiki/North_America "North America") on October 13, 2005,[17] and
later in PAL regions on December 16, 2005. The [PlayStation
2](/wiki/PlayStation_2 "PlayStation 2") version was released on PAL regions on
December 2, 2005, and later in North America on February 9, 2006.[18] The game
is about Dora and Boots who finds some lost aliens from the purple planet.
However, to take them home, she and Boots are required to collect keys to open
the space gate, leading to the saturn planet. The game is unique in that it
uses pictures and symbols to communicate rather than words. The object of the
game is to capture one of the six explorer stars. Each explorer star has a
special power such as the ability to be noisy or the ability to create music.
In order to capture the star, the player must complete a hide-and-seek
activity. These activities include maze navigation, matching games, side-
scrolling race games, a "[Frogger](/wiki/Frogger "Frogger")"-type game, a
complete-the-pattern activity and a song playing game.[19]

_Dora Puppy_ is a puppy [simulator](/wiki/Simulator "Simulator") where players
must help Dora take care of her puppy, Perrito, and help train him for doggie
[competitions](/wiki/Competitions "Competitions"). All the actions are
performed by either tracing certain shapes with the stylus or calling out
commands into the DS's microphone.[20] It was developed by [Take-Two
Interactive](/wiki/Take-Two_Interactive "Take-Two Interactive") for the
[Nintendo DS](/wiki/Nintendo_DS "Nintendo DS") and published by [2K
Play](/wiki/2K_Play "2K Play") in [North America](/wiki/North_America "North
America")[21] and Australia in 2009, and in [Europe](/wiki/Europe "Europe") in
2010.

_Dora the Explorer: Dora 's Cooking Club_ is a cooking video game for the
[Nintendo DS](/wiki/Nintendo_DS "Nintendo DS"). It was published by [2K
Play](/wiki/2K_Play "2K Play") in 2010.[22] In the game, players have to chop
veggies, stir soups, top pizzas, and more using math skills. They may be
sorting cookies into numbered groups or counting out different amounts of
ingredients.[23]

  * _Dora the Explorer: Dora Saves the Snow Princess_ is a video game that was released for the PlayStation 2 and the [Wii](/wiki/Wii "Wii") console in 2008.
  * _Dora the Explorer: Dora Saves the Crystal Kingdom_ is a video game that was released for the PlayStation 2 and the Wii console in 2009.

## Sequel

In 2013, [Nickelodeon](/wiki/Nickelodeon "Nickelodeon") announced that it will
have a sequel to _Dora the Explorer_ titled as _[Dora and Friends: Into the
City!](/wiki/Dora_and_Friends:_Into_the_City! "Dora and Friends: Into the
City!")_. It will star the Latina heroine Dora as a 10-year-old who goes on
city adventures with the Explorer Girls, accompanied by a male pal named
Pablo. The series has been picked up for 20 episodes and aired on Nickelodeon
on August 18, 2014.[24][25][26][27][28][29]
